subtitle: The 1st Call for Applications for Academic Staff for the academic year 2025-26 within the framework of the International Credit Mobility project with the University of Valladolid (Erasmus+ KA171) Détails
description: The 1st Call for Applications for Academic Stafffor the academic year 2025-26 within the framework of the International Credit Mobility project with the University of Valladolid (Erasmus+ KA171) has been issued. Deadline for applications is November 3rd, 2025 (23:59 Spanish Time). Take into your account that thisproject is not based on nominations, so allacademic staff MUST apply for the scholarship through the followingwebsite:https://uvamobplus2.uva.es/publico/apply Here you may find theCall for Applicationswith all the information to apply for the opportunities. Please read it before applying. Mobility can take place until July 17th2026. Allstaff applicants must submit their proposals for the 5-day mobility exchange. The mobility proposal must be indicated in the step 5 of the online application form. Here youwill find the list of UVAdepartments:https://uvamobplus2.uva.es/publico/courses For disseminating purposesacademicstaff could check UVAblog for Erasmus+ KA171 scholarship holders where some experiences are shown:https://erasmusplusuva.wordpress.com/

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Announcement of BIPs developed within the PolyCIVIS project Détails
description: Enrollment is now open for two new CIVIS Blended Intensive Programmes (BIPs) developed within the PolyCIVIS project! Both courses are open to Bachelor’s, Master’s, and PhD students from Europe and Africa and offer ECTS credits, international mobility, and the opportunity to engage in collaborative, cross-continental learning. 1. Enhancing Skills in Polycrisis Management: African & European Approaches (3 ECTS) : 8 May – 10 July 2026 (with physical mobility in Kampala, Uganda, 6–10 July)This interdisciplinary BIP helps studentstodevelop analytical and managerial skills to understand and respond to overlapping crises such as climate change, migration, or political instability.Learn more here:https://civis.eu/en/learn/civis-courses/enhancing-skills-in-polycrisis-management-african-and-european-approaches2. (Poly)Understanding Polycrisis: Fragility and Resilience (6 ECTS):4 May - 29 June 2026 (with physical mobility in Athens, Greece, 15-19 June 2026)This course offers students an in-depth perspective on how different systems, from local communities to global governance, experience fragility and build resilience in times of crisis. Learn more here:https://civis.eu/en/learn/civis-courses/polyunderstanding-polycrisis-fragility-and-resilienceApplication deadline: 30 October 2025

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Winter School in Italian Language and Culture Détails
description: The School for International Education atCa’ Foscari University of Veniceis pleased to announce the upcoming edition of ourWinter School in Italian Language and Culture, which will take place from26 January to 6 February 2026. Venice offers an ideal setting for a Winter School focused on both theItalian languageand the city'srich cultural heritage. Its compact, walkable nature allows students to fully immerse themselves in Venetian life, interact with the local community, and experience the authentic atmosphere of this historic city. Thistwo-week programincludes: 30 hours of Italian language classesfor complete beginners, held in the mornings at the School for International Education’s premises inPalazzina Briati.5 hours of cultural activities, taking place on selected afternoons, including guided walking tours and visits to sites of historical and artistic significance. These activities are designed to bring Italian traditions and cultural legacy to life, enriching the students’ language learning experience through direct engagement with the city’s unique context. Applications open on 6 October and close on 21 November 2025. Students can apply via the following link:Winter School 2026 – Application Form Whileaccommodation is not included, we will provide participants with a list of recommended housing options and useful contacts to help arrange their stay.

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: CALL FOR COURSE PROPOSALS INTERNATIONAL SUMMER SCHOOL 2026 Détails
description: Universidade da Coruña is pleased to announce that theCall for Course Proposalsfor the International Summer School 2026 is officially open. In the previous edition, which took place in July 2026,UDCwelcomed more than 100 students and 16 lecturers from universities across 40countries. A total of 14 courses were offered on a variety of topics, including3D scanning,international climate law,business psychology, andleadership communication, while participants also had the chance to explore our region through an engaging social activities program. If you are interested in taking part in the upcoming edition starting July 13, please find information on the requirements, accommodation, meals and so on clickinghereand submit your course proposal byOctober 20filling in the form attached! If you are going to submit your course proposal, please bear in mind our conditions: UDC will pay the visiting teacher for accommodation and mealsin a university hall of residence from 12th to 25th July (if needed, extra days and travelling companion costs may be booked by ISS team and paid by the lecturer). Should two lecturers share the same course, each of them will be paid for accommodation and meals only for one week.It should be noted that lecturers coming under aKA171Erasmus + grant agreementmust cover all the expenses with such a grant.In all cases,travel expensesshall be borne by the lecturer.

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: L’Université de Sfax renforce sa présence internationale ! Détails
description: Le Président de l’Université de Sfax, le ProfesseurAhmed Hadj Kacem, a effectué une visite officielle à l’Université Côte d’Azur (Nice, France). À cette occasion, il a rencontré le ProfesseurJeanick Brisswalter, Président de l’Université Côte d’Azur,M. Lotfi Baâlouci, Consul général de Tunisie à Nice, du ProfesseurChristophe Charlieret de MmeVirginie Oddo, Directrice du Développement International et Europe de l’Université Côte d’Azur. Cette rencontre a permis de renforcer les relations existantes entre les deux institutions et d’explorer de nouvelles perspectives de coopération. Les discussions ont porté sur la recherche scientifique, à travers la mise en place de projets conjoints et de partenariats entre établissements, ainsi que sur l’enseignement supérieur, avec le développement de programmes de mobilité pour étudiants, enseignants et chercheurs dans le cadre d’Erasmus+ et d’autres programmes européens. Cette visite illustre la volonté de l’Université de Sfax de consolider son réseau international et de bâtir des partenariats stratégiques afin de booster la formation, la recherche et l’innovation.

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Student Conference 2025 UniMe – Right to the Future: Environment, Sustainability and Innovation Détails
description: The PhD students in Political Science and Public Administration at the University of Messina are pleased to invite doctoral candidates and PhD graduates in political, legal, economic, and humanities disciplines, from both national and international institutions, to the Student Conference“Right to the Future: Environment, Sustainability, and Innovation”, which will take place on 11–13 December 2025 at the Department of Political and Legal Sciences. The conference aims to foster dialogue across different perspectives and methodologies, promoting an open and interdisciplinary exchange on the themes of the future, intergenerational justice, environmental sustainability, and technological innovation. These study days will provide a valuable opportunity for young scholars to engage with one another, enriched by the contributions of distinguished academics and experts. Please find attached the Call for Papers, with the deadline for abstract submission set for 12 October 2025. The document contains all relevant information regarding the submission process and participation in the conference. For further information:https://www.unime.it/notizie/call-papers-student-conference-2025-diritto-al-futuro-ambiente-sostenibilita-e-innovazione

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Call for Contributions: CIVIS Forum 'From Joint Challenges to Joint Solutions' (UH2C, Casablanca, 2026) Détails
description: 1stAfrican-European CIVIS Forum for Research and Education:FROM JOINT CHALLENGES TO JOINT SOLUTIONSHassan II University of Casablanca, Morocco, 25-27 March 2026The 1stCIVIS Forum provides a platform for showcasing cutting-edge research on key societal challenges, for developing new joint research projects as well as educational offers, and for engaging with societal stakeholders. It also seeks to deepen institutional ties of African and European CIVIS member institutions for long-term scientific exchange. The event is open for contributions from all 17 CIVIS member institutions in Africa and Europe: from early-career researchers, research support or administrative staff, university leaders and institutional partners. Contributors from outside the alliance are welcome, too.Full Call text, incl. submission guidelines:See attachment and/or the :https://civis.eu/en/teach-and-research/opportunities/civis-calls/call-for-contributions-from-joint-challenges-to-joint-solutionsDeadline for submitting proposals:10 October 2025Notification of acceptance:15 November 2025Please submit your proposal through the submission platform:  https://civis.smapply.io/prog/irst_african-european_civis_forum_for_research_and_education_/For questions, please contact:civis_forum_2026@lists.civis.eu

subtitle: The Winter School Program 2025 at CGC University, Mohali Détails
description: Are your students ready for a Winter of discovery, learning, and unforgettable cultural exchange? We are pleased to invite international students from your esteemed institution to participate in the Winter School Program 2025 at CGC University, Mohali — a vibrant two-week immersion into Indian culture, academics, and global collaboration.Program Dates - November 17th 2025 to January 15th 2026 Location:CGC University, Mohali, Punjab, IndiaMode:On-campusEligibility:Exclusively for international students from all academic backgrounds Program Fee: 500 USD ONLYWhat’s Included? On-campus accommodationGuided tours of cultural and historical sitesAirport pickup and drop-off (Chandigarh Airport)Cultural immersion activities and academic workshopsCertificate of ParticipationThree meals featuring authentic Indian cuisineExclusions:International travel to/from ChandigarhVisa feesPersonal expensesWhy CGC University, Mohali?CGC University, located in Mohali (Punjab), is a leading university in North India. We are accredited with anA+ rating by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC)and are ranked in theNational Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF)with our Chandigarh School of Business in the 101–125 band and our Chandigarh Engineering College in the 201–300 band.Further, we have been awarded thePlatinum rating by QS I-Gauge, recognizing our institutional quality, teaching practices, and international focus. title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Online Summer School „Be Romanian – Be European” Détails
description: The online summer school offersRomanian language and civilization coursesto foreign citizens who are motivated to learn Romanian in anintensiveandflexibleformat. The courses are taught by instructors specialized in teaching Romanian as a foreign language. Instruction will be delivered with the help of English. At the end of each module, a participation certificate will be issued and the participants’language skills will be assessed. Participants may enroll in one or more modules. Registration and payment are done separately for each module. After completing all three modules, participants may take the exam to obtain the B1-level language proficiency certificate. SCHEDULE: Module I -45 hoursFrom August 1 to August 31, 2025 Level A1 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR) Evening and weekend classes FeeRON1500 Registration open until July 10, 2025 Module II -45 hoursFrom September 1 to September 30, 2025 Level A2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR) Evening and weekend classes FeeRON1500 Registration open until August 15, 2025 Module III -60 hoursFrom October 1 to November 31, 2025 Level B1 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR) Evening and weekend classes Upon sufficient request, one week of intensive classes can be organized onsite FeeRON2000 Registration open until September 15, 2025 TO REGISTER, please: 1.Fill in the registration form available here:https://forms.gle/Nj9U5EY59bbTUftu7 You will receive confirmation of availability by email, at the latest by July 15. 2.Pay the full participation fee in RON to: Bank:BRD - GROUPE SOCIETE GENERALE SAAccount holder: Universitatea „Alexandru Ioan Cuzaˮ din Iași IBAN: RO 68 BRDE 240 SV 89534452400 SWIFT: BRDEROBUXXX Details: Faculty of Letters, Summer School Be Romanian – Be European, participation fee If required: Faculty code 1311, fee code 31, type of education 01 3.email a scanned copy of the documents below to the Department of Romanian for Foreign Students, atandrian.macari@uaic.ro: - certified translation into English or Romanian of your High School Graduation (Baccalaureate) Diploma - your identification document - proof of payment You will receive course details and link by email. title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Call for Applications for MIASA Individual Residential Fellowships for the Academic Year 2026/2027 at the University of Ghana Détails
description: TheMerian Institute for Advanced Studies in Africa (MIASA) invites applications for different types of residential fellowships at the University of Ghana. The Institute offers time and space for supporting innovative academic projects in the Humanities and Social Sciences of top international quality. MIASA supports these projects via different kinds of fellowships. For theAcademic Year 2026/27MIASA is offering up to fiveIndividual Residential Fellowshipsfor 3-6 months each at the University of Ghana Earliest starting point for Individual Fellowships is September 2026.The application deadline is 15 September 2025. MIASA is broadly dedicated to research in the Humanities and Social Sciences, with ‘Sustainable Governance’ as its central topic. Overarching aims of MIASA are working towards a reduction of global asymmetries in knowledge production and bridging the cultural divide between anglophone, francophone and lusophone Africa. MIASA, established in 2018, serves as a hub for exchange, networking and collaboration amongst leading researchers from Germany, Ghana, the African and European continents, and beyond. It is located on the beautiful campus of the University of Ghana at Legon (Accra).It is supported by the German Federal Ministry for Research, Technology and Space (BMFTR) with co-funding from the University of Ghana.For more information see the attached calls or go to:https://miasa.ug.edu.gh/fellowship-programme/

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: International Conference on Sustainability and Business Futures (ICSBF 2025) Détails
description: We are pleased to invite you to submit your research article to theInternational Conference on Sustainability and Business Futures (ICSBF 2025), jointly organized by the School of Business, Woxsen University, India, and the University of Granada, Spain, to be held virtually onOctober 30–31, 2025. Conference Theme:Navigating Climate Change, Technology, and Social Impact In an era of global transformation, sustainability is no longer optional—it is essential. ICSBF 2025 aims to explore how businesses can lead the way in addressing climate change, leveraging technology, and creating meaningful social impact. We welcome original contributions in the form of: Research Papers (Qualitative, Quantitative, or Mixed Methods)Review PapersConceptual Papers Conference Tracks: Climate Change as a Value Driver for BusinessesDigital Governance for Advancing SustainabilityCollaborative Partnerships in Technology for Business SustainabilityEnvironment and Renewable Energy SolutionsSustainable Finance: Green and Impact Investing, ESG and InnovationSocial Impact for a Sustainable Future Important Dates: Abstract Submission Starts: 3rdJune 2025 (Please submit your Abstract aticsbf@woxsen.edu.in) Abstract Decision: Within 2 weeks of submission Full Paper Submission Deadline: September 25, 2025 Registration Closes: September 30, 2025 Spot Submissions: October 15, 2025 All submissions will undergo a peer review process. Accepted papers will be presented virtually and recommended for publication with partnered publishers. Publication Opportunities: Selected papers will be considered for publication in ABDC/Web of Science-listed journals, including: Journal of Statistics and Management Systems (JSMS) (ABDC-C) (APC: INR 16000/USD 550 for International Participants) Registration Fees (Please Pay the Registration Fees aticsbf.woxsen.edu.in)

description: TheUniversity of Salerno, Italy, has launched the call for applications 2025/2026 for Master scholarships opportunities. The scholarship programme aims to recruit a total of50 non-EU students, resident abroad and in possession of a qualification obtained abroad, for the University’s Master’s degree courses. For this year, the 50 scholarships are allocated to specific geographical areas or countries as follows: 10 places: candidates from non-European universities associated with UNIMED;10 places: Argentina;5 places: Central Asia (Kazakhstan, Kirghizistan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan);5 places: Africa;5 places: Colombia;2 places: Vietnam;8 places: candidates from universities with which UNISA has international cooperation agreements;5 places: other countries or regions not listed above. Deadline for application: 20th June 2025, 23:59 (CEST).

description: Le projet DIRASA lance son appel pour la sélection d’unprestataire chargé de la réalisation d’une vidéo promotionnellesur les activités et les résultats du projet. Cette vidéo institutionnelle, accompagnée de capsules vidéo pour chaque université partenaire, vise à valoriser les activités et les résultats du projet DIRASA. Le prestataire devra disposer d’une expérience avérée dans la production de vidéos pour des projets financés par l’Union européenne, ainsi que des compétences techniques en tournage, montage, création graphique et animation. Cette activité est coordonné par UNIMED – Union des Universités de la Méditerranée. Veuillez envoyer votre candidature d’ici le 30/05/2025 à:uni-med@pec.it Téléchargez lesTermes de Référencepour plus d’informations.

description: We are pleased to announce the5th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence & Knowledge Processing (AIKP’25), to be held fromOctober 23–25, 2025, atENAE International Business School, Spain, in ahybrid format(in-person and virtual participation). AIKP’25is a prestigious global conference jointly hosted by theAI Research Centre, Woxsen University, in collaboration with leading institutions acrossIndia, Spain, USA, South Africa, UAE, and Saudi Arabia. Conference Collaborators: ENAE Business School, Spain University of St. Thomas, USA University of Johannesburg, South Africa University of Fujairah – جامعة الفجيرة, UAE Dar Al-Hekma University, Saudi Arabia Conference Themes: We welcome original research papers in, but not limited to, the following areas: Generative AI & Large Language Models (LLMs) Cognitive Computing & Knowledge Systems Ethical AI & Governance Applied Machine Learning Multilingual NLP & Edge AI All accepted and presented papers will be published by Springer in the renowned CCIS (Communications in Computer and Information Science) series. Key Deadlines: ·Full Paper Submission:June 22, 2025 ·Notification of Acceptance:July 20, 2025 ·Camera-Ready Submission:July 30, 2025 ·Registration Deadline:August 5, 2025Paper Submission Link:https://lnkd.in/gAwwg3TTConference Website:https://aikp25.aircwou.in/

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Call for Applications – CIVIS Blended Intensive Programmes (BIP) Détails
description: Travel abroad, learn new skills, get hands-on experience, and expand your knowledge with CIVIS’ interdisciplinary and challenge-based short-term courses. CIVIS’ Blended Intensive Programmes (BIP) combine a virtual learning phase with the in-person participation in a physical course element (winter/summer school format) of about one week at a CIVIS university in Europe.Several BIP are open to Master and/or PhD students from Associate Member universities of CIVIS in Africa. You can apply, if you meet the application requirements and if your home university is listed for the particular course you are interested in.List of courses and institutional eligibility of Blended Intensive Programmes open to MA/PhD students from Associate Member Universities (Africa):https://airtable.com/appWuJxe4USefuAnM/shrrPhXIhR4Wmr9Fi Further information on CIVIS Blended Intensive Programmes and a list of all CIVIS courses:https://civis.eu/en/civis-courses Questions & Answers on Blended Intensive Programmes:https://civis.eu/en/blended-intensive-programmes/qanda-on-BIPs Application deadline:11/05/2025 More information on CIVIS and the strategic partnership with your university:https://civis.eu/ ________ CIVIS Blended Intensive Programme (BIP) open to students from Université de Sfax Global Migration on the Ground Explore the realities of global migration through interdisciplinary analysis, hands-on field research, and engagement with civil society organizations. Open to:Master students Field of studies:Social Science and humanities, Environmental Sciences; Urbanism, Geography Host university of the physical part:University of Tübingen (UT), GermanyApplication deadline: 11/05/2025Full course description and application information: Global Migration on the Ground – News – CIVIS - A European University Alliance LINK to application platform:https://mobility.civis.eu/templates/67d7f7ea9a52af728361ae19/start Mediterranean Renaissance: Art and Literature Reassess the Renaissance (XIV-XVII) from the perspective of Mediterranean Studies, with an emphasis on interdisiplinarity and intercultural exchanges Open to:PhD students, Master students Field of studies:Art, Design and Media; Social Science and humanities Host university of the physical part:Universidad Autónoma de Madrid (UAM), SpainApplication deadline: 11/05/2025Full course description and application information: Mediterranean Renaissance: Art and Literature – News – CIVIS - A European University Alliance LINK to application platform:https://mobility.civis.eu/templates/67d7f7ea9a52af728361ae19/start Digital Transformation of the Democratic Discourse Step into the future of democracy by joining a one-of-a-kind course where digital innovation meets civic action, and co-create solutions to reshape public discourse. Open to:PhD students, Master students Field of studies:Art, Design and Media; Business and Management; Computer Science and IT; Engineering & Technology; Law; Social Science and humanities Host university of the physical part:University of Lausanne (CH), SwitzerlandApplication deadline: 11/05/2025Full course description and application information: Digital Transformation of the Democratic Discourse – News – CIVIS - A European University Alliance LINK to application platform:https://mobility.civis.eu/templates/67d7f7ea9a52af728361ae19/start Attractiveness, branding and governance of regions Exploring the region to coordinate public policies and ensure its attractiveness. Open to:PhD students, Master students Field of studies:Business and Management; Social Science and humanities Host university of the physical part:University of Lausanne (CH), SwitzerlandApplication deadline: 11/05/2025Full course description and application information: Attractiveness, branding and governance of regions – News – CIVIS - A European University Alliance LINK to application platform:https://mobility.civis.eu/templates/67d7f7ea9a52af728361ae19/start Strategic Foresight Learn how to identify emerging trends, assess complex risks, and explore potential futures with an eye on compiling likely future scenarios underpining decision-making geared towards more resilient and sustainable policies. description: CIVIS STAFF WEEKMicrocredentials in Lifelong Learning The CIVIS Staff Training Week forMicrocredentials in Lifelong Learningis a three-day event organised to immerse and promote the engagement of CIVIS members related to lifelong learning activities. The programme promises to be a dynamic platform for knowledge exchange and the creation of new initiatives in the field of micro-credentials.Participants will have the opportunity to hear from experts across various European centers, and Alliances, who will share their experiences and best practices. Application Deadline:11 May 2025Dates:2-4 July 2025Location/host:Université de Lausanne (UNIL), SwitzerlandFunding for participants from CIVIS Associate Member Universities (Africa):UNIL provides funds covering the participation of a limited number of staff members from CIVIS universities in Africa. The selection will be done according to the mostrelevant profile for contributing to the staff week objectives. Further information and application (detailed programme will be added soon to this website): https://civis.eu/en/learn/civis-courses/micro-credentials-from-idea-generation-to-delivery

subtitle: CIVIS info #217 Détails
description: LAUNCH - 2nd call for seed fundingThe 2nd CIVIS seed funding call is open for applicationsuntil 31st May!The aim of the call is to promote research collaborations between our partner universities, including our associate members from African universities.As last year, this call is open to all members of CIVIS universities (see call for more details on the conditions of participation) in order to finance two types of activities:New collaborative research activitiesApplication design measuresResults beginning of November at the latestProjects may be carried out between November 1st, 2025 and June 30th, 2026.You can find all the information you needon the dedicated page, andan info session is scheduled for April 14th, 2025 from 12.00 to 13.00to present the call's objectives and application's modalities in more details (registration linkhere).We count on you for the wide dissemination of the call information, especially on the info session! ­2nd Student led projects call­The 2nd call for Student-led Projects is still open until30th April.This will bring opportunities for students of CIVIS universities to develop new collaboration and create new activitiesLinkhereto the CIVIS websiteLinkhereto discover the projects led by our students in 2024-2025­­Rolling Open Lab Call­Applications to the rolling call can be submitted byacademics, researchers and stafffrom CIVIS but interested stakeholders and students can contact the local Open Lab Coordinatorsto be put in relation with academics.All the information and guidance documents can be found in the call webpagehere.­ Promotion campaign - BIPs are open to students!The new CIVIS BIPs open to students applications are online.Linkhereto the BIPsPlease note that there are still some BIPs that are not online because of pending information from teachersApplication deadline:4th May 2025May the Fourth be with our CIVIS students! ­ Survey - Visa problems in African-European academic mobilityWe kindly invite you to disseminate the following two surveys produced by GPO and designed to:explore the extent and nature of the 'visa problem' that limits academic mobility between Europe and Africainvestigate how to address the situation at the institutional, national, and European (EU) levelThere are French, English and Portuguese version of the surveys.One surveyaddresses academics (lecturer/researcher/professor) and students (including PhD candidates)from African countries, who applied for visa in the past to go to a European country for an academic purpose.The otheraddresses persons from AfricanandEuropean Universities responsible for managing or implementing mobilities of students, academics, or university (Higher Education Institutions) staff from African countries to Europe on a regular basis.You can also findherea proposal of message to disseminate to the right audience to help increase the response rate. ­ ­ ­ Updated CIVIS calendar­9th-11th April Units Summit at UB14th AprilMobility Unit15th April10h-11h30MC17th April9h30-12h30SC10h-11h30Communication Unit22nd April10h-12hMC24th April10h-11h30Research Unit28th April10h-11h30Mobility Unit29th April10h-11h30MC7th May10h-12hWPL10h-11h30OL Council13th-14th May MC at SU15th May9h30-12h30SC10h-11h30 Communication unit20th May10h-11h30MC22nd May10h-12hWP1 governance10h-11h30Research Unit26th May10h-11h30Mobility Unit27th May10h-11h30MC

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: INTERNATIONAL TEACHING EXCELLENCE PROGRAM” (ITEP 2025): CHANDIGARH GROUP OF COLLEGES JHANJERI, Mohali, Punjab, India. Détails
description: It is our great pleasure to invite faculties from your esteemed university to participate in our“INTERNATIONAL TEACHING EXCELLENCE PROGRAM” (ITEP 2025), which will be held from23rd JUNE TO 28th JUNE 2025atCHANDIGARH GROUP OF COLLEGES JHANJERI, Mohali, Punjab, India.About CGC Jhanjeri: Chandigarh Group of Colleges, Jhanjeri (CGC-J), located in Mohali, Punjab, India, is a premier Institution with NAAC A+ Accreditation. CGC-J achieved a remarkable debut in NIRF ranking in 2024 with 101-150 band for Business School and 201-300 band for Engineering College at PAN India level. Our commitment to experiential learning and innovation has garnered numerous awards and recognition, making us one of the fastest-growing educational institutions. Our vibrant, multicultural campus is a home for more than 10,600 students from 25+ countries, fostering an inclusive and globalized learning environment.The CGC Jhanjeri has established formal tie – ups with more than 200+ top ranked universities in 60+ countries of the world. Our strong ties with industry have led to the establishment of numerous industry-sponsored Centers of Excellence and labs that support faculty and student research. With over 2000+ patents filed and 75+ active projects, CGC Jhanjeri is recognized as North India's Fastest Growing Private Institution and a leading hub for engineering education.  You can know more on our website atwww.cgc.ac.in. About ITEP 2025: TheInternational Teaching Excellence Program (ITEP 2025)aims to foster faculty development through interaction with global experts in various academic disciplines. Faculty members from different departments will engage in workshops, seminars, and networking events to exchange knowledge and explore the latest advancements in their fields. The program will run from23rd June to 28th June 2025, with department-specific sessions scheduled throughout the week (see attached list for details).We are honored to inviteyou and other esteemed experts from your universityto participate as resource persons for this program. We believe your expertise will greatly enrich the experience for our faculty. We would be grateful if you could recommend colleagues from your institution who may also wish to contribute to this valuable initiative.Logistics and Support: During your visit, we will be happy to provide the following: Airport pickup from Chandigarh International Airport (IXC)Local transportation and hospitality during your stayA leisure tour of the city and surrounding areas Important Dates: Review Committee Results & Invitation Issuance:By 20th April  2025Topic Finalization & Last Date to Confirm Participation & Submit ProfileBy 30th April  2025Finalization of Expert Itinerary:By 10th May 2025Confirmation of Hotel and Logistics + Final Schedule of ITEP 2025:By 25th May 2025Registration Link:https://forms.gle/WxvmkZ8c1774H6HFA Please find attached additional information about CGC Jhanjeri, including avideo overviewandlist of courses offered. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WjRx_0YdNgZJCdzlqrE6ZBd0HEqLNGOL/view https://drive.google.com/file/d/189OoftUyQi9pHPMCwJLz_BwU-_RvZJnL/view

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: CALL FOR APPLICATIONS: CIVIS Micro-programme: Global Awareness Détails
description: Open to:Bachelor, Master students from all CIVIS universities (African and European), from all subject areas and disciplinesParticipation mode:onlineCosts:free of chargeApplication deadline:31 March 2025 More information:https://civis.eu/en/learn/civis-courses/global-awareness CIVIS micro-programmes allow students to combine multiple CIVIS courses or modules into one coherent learning pathway which reinforces or complements their main study programme.The Micro-Programme on Global Awareness offers students of all subjects and degrees the possibility to acquire transdisciplinary competencies in the comprehension and analysis of global and cross-border phenomena. Meeting global challenges - such as issues concerning energy, the climate and the environment - is a core aspiration of the CIVIS Alliance. With this in mind, CIVIS member universities the University of Bucharest, the Universidad Autónoma de Madrid and the University of Tübingen have launched a joint micro-programme on Global Awareness. It provides in-depth knowledge about globalisation and cross-border processes, as well as opportunities to reflect on global interconnections and interrelationships in everyday life. Covering a broad range of topics and approaches, the courses offered in this program foster the development of inter- and transdisciplinary competencies and problem-solving skills to deal with the social, cultural, economic, legal, political and ecological problems of our time, preventing racism and fostering peace and understanding. In this way, students are equipped to become responsible actors in a globalised world. The micro-programme Global Awareness is a flexible way to complement your studies. It comprises 15 ECTS which should be earned in courses offered by, at least, two universities participating in the programme, in a period of two years after acceptance (or until you graduate, if it happens before the two years are complete). The courses also have a very flexible schedule. They follow the calendar of the university which offers them. It means that there are new courses beginning almost every month! The micro-programme Global Awareness gives you flexibility when it comes to planning your time, choosing your learning strategies, and meeting your needs. The courses are offered mostly online, with some courses in presence. Their formats vary from block seminars, intensive courses as summer schools, to courses that cover the entire lecture period, following the academic calendars of the three participating universities. For this reason, the courses may have different schedules than you are used to at your home university. The courses are offered mostly in English and are attended by students from different universities, which gives you the possibility to internationalize your studies. They are certified according to workload (for example, 3 ECTS = 75-90 h workload) and their assignments are marked with pass/not pass. The graduation requirement of the micro-programme is the achievement of 15 ECTS under these conditions: attended courses were offered by the micro-programme Global Awareness,courses were attended in, at least, two of the three participating universities, with at least two course in two different universities,credit points were earned within a period of two years after acceptance in the micro-programme (or less, if you graduate before the period of two years is complete). You are expected to complete, at least, two courses in the first year after you were accepted in the micro-programme. There is not any additional final examination form. The micro-programme is open to students from all subjects and degrees currently enrolled in a CIVIS University, and is completely free of charge. More information:https://civis.eu/en/learn/civis-courses/global-awareness

We are very much looking forward to hearing from you and your students and to cooperating with you again in the frame of ourFOR APAC International Austrian EU Summer School 2025! Yours sincerely, Judith Suchanek In the name of the FOR APAC Team

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: TÜ-VIP Détails
description: Dear students, If you want to study abroad, keep reading! If you, for whatever reason, are not able or not willing to travel, keep reading too! Imagine meeting once a week with students from around the world to talk about things that truly matter to you, in real-time!TÜ-VIP is a 10-week, free-of-charge online program organised by the University of Tübingen, Germany, offering courses on Artificial Intelligence, Gender Equality, Sustainability, Politics, Intercultural Communication, German and other language courses, as well as classes on Identity, Culture, and Human Rights (4 ECTS credits per course). We even have an online buddy program so you can get to know Tübingen and what life is like here. Our courses can be taken in addition to your studies at home while opening doors for networking and future careers. TÜ-VIP courses prepare you perfectly for a later stay abroad, possibly at Tübingen University. TÜ-VIP is also open for those returning home after studying here! Find out more on our website:https://uni-tuebingen.de/de/234782

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Hackathon de 24H "Chaussure Eco-responsable" Détails
description: Vous êtes passionné(e) par l’industrie de la chaussure et/ou par le monde du marketing et du digital ?L'environnement est une priorité pour vous ?Cet appel à candidatures est fait pour vous afin de participer à l’Hackathon de 24H "Chaussure Eco-responsable" organisé par le Projet VRR - Sabat Sfakys sous l’égide du l’Université de Sfax et en partenariat avec le Centre National du Cuir et de la Chaussure & le Pôle Etudiant Entrepreneur de Sfax :Date : Samedi 30 novembre & dimanche 1er décembre 2024Début : Samedi 09h00 (1ère mi-temps : 09h00 – 00h00)Clôture : Dimanche 17h00 (2ème mi-temps : 08h00-17h00)Lieu : Faculté de médecine de Sfax – Avenue Majida BoulillaCe Hackathon réunira des équipes multidisciplinaires qui entreront en compétition pour :• Concevoir un prototype d’une chaussure innovante. Vous aurez à votre disposition ... imprimantes 3D et une machine CNC (Computer Numerical Control), .....• Proposer des pratiques novatrices et exploiter le potentiel du digital pour une meilleure commercialisation de cette chaussure non seulement sur une échelle nationale mais aussi mondiale.Les équipes seront regroupées en fonction de la discipline.Une équipe gagnante de chaque discipline sera sélectionnée.L’aventure ne s’arrêtera pas à ce niveau. Les membres des deux équipes gagnantes souhaitant faire partie des fondateurs de la startup « Chaussure éco-responsable » manifesteront leur intérêt pour terminer l’aventure d’accompagnement jusqu’à la pré labellisation et/ou la labellisation.Date limite de participation : Dimanche le 24 novembre 2024 à minuit.Sabat SfakysFaculté De Médecine De SFAX ( FMSF )Pôle Etudiant Entrepreneur de Sfa

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Atelier "Réussir votre proposition pour les appels Horizon Europe -Clusters 2 & 3" Détails
description: L’Unité de Gestion par Objectifs chargée du programme-cadre européen pour la recherche et l'Innovation Horizon Europe [UGPO-HE], Ministère de l'Enseignement Supérieur et de la Recherche Scientifique [MESRS], organise en collaboration avec la Faculté des Sciences Economiques et de Gestion de Tunis, Université de Tunis El Manar, un atelier"Réussir votre proposition pour les appels des Clusters 2 (Culture, créativité et Société inclusive) et 3 (Sécurité civile pour la société)"d'HORIZON EUROPE, et ce le mercredi27 novembre 2024à la Faculté des Sciences Economiques et de Gestion de Tunis à partir de 08h30. Cet atelier permettra de présenter aux porteurs d'idées de projets les opportunités de financement et les exigences spécifiques des Clusters 2 et 3 du pilier 2 d'Horizon Europe, et comportera une démonstration sur la préparation de propositions. Nous avons le plaisir de vous convier à cet atelier en vous inscrivant à travers celien,et ce avant le25 Novembre 2024 à 10h. Pour plus d'informations, veuillez consulterla note conceptuelle et l'agenda. En vous remerciant par avance de votre intérêt, veuillez agréer, Madame, Monsieur, l'expression de nos sentiments les plus cordiaux.

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Les universités tunisiennes s’imprègnent de l’esprit scientifique de Pise Détails
description: [Pise, 11 Octobre 2024] – Le projet DIRASA vient de conclure sa deuxième visite de terrain et échange des bonnes pratiques en Europe à l’Université de Pise, aprèscelle menée à l’Université de Pavie. Cette visite, axée sur lesbonnes pratiques en matière de veille stratégique et de performance dans la gestion de la recherche, a permis de mettre en lumière les atouts de cette institution prestigieuse.Les principaux enseignements de la visite Pendant les deux journées de visite, le 10 et 11 octobre, les échanges ont porté sur une multitude de sujets, allant de la gestion de la recherche et des politiques incitatives aux bonnes pratiques de l’université en matière de qualité, de durabilité et de collaboration internationale, et ont révélé de nombreuses pratiques exemplaires. Parmi celles-ci, on peut citer : Des services de soutien sur mesure :Les participants ont découvert les nombreux services mis en place pour accompagner les chercheurs tout au long de leurs projets, de la recherche de financement à la valorisation des résultats.Une approche globale de la recherche :L’Université de Pise a démontré une approche intégrée de la recherche, associant excellence scientifique, impact sociétal et collaboration internationale.Une approche intégrée de la qualité :L’université a mis en place un système d’assurance qualité rigoureux pour garantir l’excellence de ses activités de recherche et d’enseignement.Une culture de l’innovation :L’université encourage l’innovation et la prise de risque, comme en témoignent les nombreux projets de recherche ambitieux dans des domaines de recherche clés tels que la transition énergétique et la durabilité. Immersion au cœur de la recherche pisane Au-delà des échanges théoriques, les participants ont eu l’opportunité devisiter le prestigieux Centre E. Piaggio, un pôle d’excellence en matière de recherche interdisciplinaire. Ils ont également effectué desvisites dans les départementsde Sciences de la Terre, de Biologie et de Recherche Translationnelle et de Nouvelles Technologies en Médecine et Chirurgie de l’Université de Pise. Grâce aux échanges directs avec les chercheurs et les administrateurs, les participants ont pu découvrir les avancées scientifiques dans ces domaines, poser des questions, partager leurs expériences et identifier de potentielles collaborations futures. Les bénéfices pour les universités tunisiennes Ces échanges ont permis d’identifier les majeures pistes de travail pour l’amélioration des processus de recherche scientifique en Tunisie et créer un espace de recherche plus ouvert, plus innovant et mieux adapté aux défis du XXIe siècle. Les participants ont notamment évoqué : Le renforcement des échanges entre chercheurspour favoriser l’émergence de projets collaboratifs.La mise en place de programmes de formation communspour développer les compétences des chercheurs.Le partage de données et de bonnes pratiquespour accélérer la transition vers une recherche plus ouverte et collaborative. Vers une cellule de veille stratégique en Tunisie Fortes de ces échanges fructueux, les participantes sont encore mieux armées pour le suivi du projet et soutenir les chercheurs et leurs établissements dans leur quête d’excellence. La visite a marqué une autre étape cruciale dans la formation des universités tunisiennes pour lefutur développement des cellules de veille stratégique, qui auront pour mission d’aider les équipes de recherche à se positionner sur les appels à projets et d’évaluer la performance de l’université dans le domaine de la recherche. Les prochaines étapes La troisième et dernière visite sur terrain se tiendra à l’Université de Rouen Normandie en fin novembre 2024. Cette visite sera l’occasion de découvrir les spécificités du modèle français en matière de veille stratégique et de renforcer les échanges entre les partenaires du projet. Restez connectés ! Pour être tenus informés des dernières actualités du projet DIRASA et des résultats de la visite à Rouen, suivez-nous surFacebook,LinkedInetXou consultez notre site web :https://dirasa.eu/.

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Les universités tunisiennes s’inspirent des meilleures pratiques européennes : L’Université de Pavie Détails
description: [Pavie, le 9 Octobre 2024] – Une délégation des universités tunisiennes partenaires de notre projet DIRASA s’est rendue le 7 et 8 octobre à l’Université de Pavie pour la première d’unesérie de visites de terrain et échange des bonnes pratiques en Europedédiées à la veille stratégique et à la performance en recherche. L’objectif à long terme de ces visites est desoutenir le processus de création de cellules de veille stratégique et de performance au sein de chaque université tunisiennepour renforcer leur autonomie et les aider à mieux se positionner et à répondre aux appels à projets nationaux et internationaux et à évaluer la performance de l’Université en matière de recherche scietifique. Les principaux enseignements de la visite de Pavia Au cours de ces deux journées, l’Université de Pavie a ouvert ses portes pour présenter les outils et les méthodes qu’elle met en œuvre pour optimiser la gestion de ses projets de recherche. Les échanges ont porté sur différents aspects, notamment : La gestion de projets de recherche: Les participants ont découvert les meilleures pratiques pour concevoir, gérer et évaluer des projets de recherche, de l’acquisition de fonds jusqu’à la valorisation des résultats.La formation doctorale: Les programmes de doctorat de l’Université de Pavia ont été présentés en détail, mettant en lumière les mécanismes de sélection, d’accompagnement et d’évaluation des doctorants.L’évaluation institutionnelle: Les outils et les méthodes utilisés par l’Université de Pavie pour évaluer la qualité de ses enseignements et de sa recherche ont été expliqués.La coopération internationale: Les programmes Erasmus+ et les actions Marie Skłodowska-Curie ont été mis en avant comme des leviers essentiels pour développer des collaborations internationales et renforcer les réseaux de recherche. Le deuxième jour de la visite a été consacré à la découverte duCentro Grandi Strumenti. Ce centre, doté d’équipements de pointe et d’une expertise reconnue dans divers domaines scientifiques, offre un soutien précieux aux chercheurs de l’université. Les participants ont pu visiter les différents laboratoires et s’informer sur les possibilités de collaboration. Les bénéfices pour les universités tunisiennes Cette visite, riche en échanges et en découvertes, a permis aux participants de s’inspirer des meilleures pratiques. Grâce à cette visite, les universités tunisiennes participantes ont pu : Identifier les bonnes pratiques à adopter pour améliorer leur gestion de la recherche.Découvrir de nouveaux outils et méthodes pour renforcer leur visibilité et leur attractivité à l’international.Établir des contacts avec des chercheurs et des experts européens. Plusieurs points clés ont été mis en évidence: L’importance des infrastructures :L’importance d’investir dans des équipements de pointe pour mener des recherches de haut niveau.L’interdisciplinarité :La nécessité d’une approche interdisciplinaire pour relever les grands défis scientifiques du monde.La collaboration internationale :Les partenariats avec des institutions étrangères sont un modèle à suivre. Un avenir prometteur pour la recherche tunisienne Le projet DIRASA ouvre de nouvelles perspectives pour la recherche en Tunisie. En s’appuyant sur les compétences et les expériences acquises lors de ces visites, les universités tunisiennes seroint mieux armées pour relever les défis de la recherche à l’échelle internationale. Vous êtes chercheur, enseignant-chercheur ou acteur de l’innovation en Tunisie ?N’hésitez pas à nous contacter pour en savoir plussur le projet DIRASA et les actions mises en œuvre pour soutenir la recherche dans votre pays.

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Istanbul Kültür University Invites You to Experience Studying at Istanbul in Spring Semester of the Academic Year 2024-2025 Détails
description: Definition of Erasmus + KA171 The project is coordinated by Istanbul Kültür University (IKU) as a Programme Country. IKU will administer all grant payments for mobility to Europe ("incoming") and from Europe ("outgoing"). The University of Sfaxis responsible for collecting applications of the prospective exchange students and providing them with all necessary support including pre-departure preparation, monitoring during mobility, and formally recognizing the mobility period. The receiving institution (IKU) offers students a study programme at the university and allocates grants for the students qualified to be an exchange student at IKU. Departments and Quotas Department / UnitLanguageQuotaComputer EngineeringIndustrial EngineeringCivil EngineeringElectric-Electronic EngineeringBusiness AdministrationInternational RelationsInternational Trade and FinanceArchitectureEnglish Language and LiteratureEnglish1 Application Requirements ·Being a full-time student enrolled in a program ofThe University of Sfaxin undergraduate degree ·For Bachelor students; having minimum2.50Grade Point Average out of4.00 ·The minimum foreign language proficiency level isB2(Intermediate).* ·Having at least30 ECTS(European Credit Transfer System) or equivalent study load per semester (Students who have not fulfilled the requirements for graduation yet). ·Period of the mobility: All the study mobilities are obligated to be realized in the spring term of2024-2025 Academic Year from 5 February 2025 to 27 June 2025. * Students can count the results of the English exam they have taken before, or the results of the foreign language exam (TOELF IBT, Pearson). Erasmus Grade Erasmus Grade is used as an instrument by IKU to evaluate and to rank the applicants. Please see below how Erasmus Grade is calculated: ØErasmus Grade = English Exam (to be converted to hundredths and %50 is taken)+ GPA at home university(to be converted to hundredthsand %50 is taken) Erasmus + International Credit Mobility 2024-2025 Spring Term applications andcriteriaused to evaluate the following are given below: •If the participant has any physical disabilities, a document that proves the disability (In English or in original language with an English document from the sending university confirming the genuinity).: +10 points Selection Criteria The selection of students - as well as the procedure for awarding them a grant - must be fair, transparent, coherent and documented and shall be made available to all parties involved in the selection process. Selections are carried out by ranking the points from the highest to the lowest, taking into account the evaluation criteria and weighted scores announced byThe University of Sfaxamong the students who fulfill the minimum requirements. The selection criteria should be fair, transparent and objectively applicable to all potential beneficiaries. How to Apply? To be accepted as an exchange student at IKU, you are required to complete and provide us with following documents in English: ·The online applicationis free of charge. For filling in the application use only the link we have provided you with. ·Transcript of Records (It must be issued in English and confirmed by the relevant person at your home University) ·National ID and/or Passport; ·Language Certificate (If you do not have an international certificate, ask your university to confirm your level of English.) ·Motivation Letter* ·Europass CV* * Motivation Letter and CV is not included within the scoring criteria. If there are applications with equal scores, motivation letter and CV can be taken into consideration. Online Application Procedures ·Online application portal:https://exchangeprogram.iku.edu.tr/Account/Login.aspx?pId=2035&ReturnUrl=%2FDefault.aspx%3FpId%3D2034 ·Applications are made through the Istanbul Kültür University website on the dates specified in the academic calendar. ·Applicants should fill up the required information and upload the relevant documents to the system. ·Application documents must be in Turkish or English. ·Any application with missing or forged documents / information will not be evaluated. ·Each applicant is eligible to make only one application ·In order for your application to be valid, you must press the Complete Application Button. Otherwise, your application will not be considered. Grant Payments IKU will be responsible for signing the grant agreement with the participant (incoming student) and thereafter transfer grants to the selected students. 1.Nominated students will receive a grant ofEUR 800per month for4 monthsduring the period of study mobility (total amount is 3200 Euro). 2.Travel support (round way ticket) is also provided for students. The amount of travel grant must be calculated using the "Distance Calculator". The distance calculator is accessible from the following link: http://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/tools/distance_en.htm Home CountryHost CountryMonthly GrantPartner CountryTurkey800 € CountryTravel SupportTunisia275 € (500-1999 km) 3.Eramus exchange student who will come to our university must fill the grant agreement before coming to study at IKU. Students who do not have a grant contract are not paid a grant. 70% of the student's total grant payment is transferred to the Euro account after the student arrives at our university. In order for Erasmus exchange students to receive their remaining grants (30%), they must have passed at least 2/3 of the courses stated in their learning agreements. Announcement of Results As a result of the evaluation, all applicants are ranked according to the Erasmus + General Achievement Grade and the International Office announcements are published on the partner University website (the list of students who are eligible to become Erasmus exchange students). ØFor more information, please contact the International Office of Istanbul Kültür University (uib@iku.edu.tr). Announcement Date: 10.10.2024 Application Start Date: 10.10.2024 Application Deadline: 02.11.2024 Contact:uib@iku.edu.tr For IKU Offical Page:https://uib.iku.edu.tr/en For Academic Calendar:https://www.iku.edu.tr/en/academic-calendar For Academic Package:https://akademikpaket.iku.edu.tr/EN/ects.php

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Invitation au TrainRail Hackathon – Région Afrique 2024 Détails
description: L'Institut de Formation Ferroviaire (IFF), en partenariat avec l'Union Internationale des Chemins de Fer (UIC), a le plaisir de vous inviter à participer à la compétition TrainRail Hackathon de la région Afrique, qui se déroulerales 22, 23 et 24 novembre 2024à l’institut de formation ferroviaire (IFF), Rabat. Cet événement rassemblant plus d’une cinquantaine de jeunes talents africains, est une occasion unique pour les étudiants et les salariés du secteur ferroviaire africain de se réunir et de collaborer sur des projets innovants dans le domaine ferroviaire. Les participants auront l'opportunité de développer des prototypes, des applications ou des services en utilisant les nouvelles technologies, tout en bénéficiant d'un environnement de travail collaboratif et stimulant. Nous serions honorés de compter parmi les participants des étudiants de l’UNIVERSITE DE SFAX, qui pourront non seulement démontrer leurs compétences techniques et créatives, mais aussi se préparer à représenter la région Afrique lors de la finale mondiale qui aura lieu en avril 2025 à Chengdu, en Chine, dans le cadre de la cérémonie d'ouverture du Congrès mondial de l'UIC sur la formation ferroviaire (WCRT 2025). L'inscription à l'événement aura lieu du2 septembre au 7 octobre 2024via le lien suivant : https://forms.gle/hQkuYmVZBnjFbtXP9

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Exploration du Rapport DIRASA sur la Gouvernance de la Recherche en Tunisie Détails
description: La Tunisie, bien que confrontée à de nombreux défis économiques et sociaux, s’engage résolument à devenir une économie fondée sur la connaissance grâce à des investissements soutenus dans la recherche et le développement (R&D). LeRapport final sur l’État des lieux de la Gouvernance de la Recherche en Tunisierécemment publié fournitune analyse approfondie de l’état actuel de la gouvernance de la recherche dans le pays, en identifiant à la fois ses réussites et des pistes d’amélioration pour le système. Depuis la révolution de 2010, la Tunisie a connu des transformations notables, mais reste encore confrontée à des défis majeurs tels que le chômage et les inégalités régionales. Malgré ces obstacles, la production scientifique tunisienne a augmenté de 20 % entre 2019 et 2022, plaçant le pays au 12ème rang mondial en termes de publications scientifiques. Cette progression est le fruit d’une politique ambitieuse qui vise à intégrer les résultats de la recherche dans les secteurs économiques clés, tout en favorisant des collaborations internationales. Travail Accompli pour la Production du Rapport Le travail accompli pour la production du Rapport sur l’État des lieux de la Gouvernance de la Recherche en Tunisiea été rigoureux et complet. Il a impliqué plusieurs étapes clés, notamment : Recherche et synthèse des références documentaires pertinentes pour la gouvernance de la recherche en Tunisie.Un travail debenchmarking, c’est-à-dire d’évaluation et de comparaison du système tunisien par rapport aux systèmes des partenaires européens du projet DIRASA (France, Italie).La consultation des universités tunisiennes et des directeurs généraux des structures de gouvernance de la recherche en Tunisie (DGRS, DGVR, CNEARS, ANPR) pour valider les informations et identifier les besoins actuels et futurs de la recherche en Tunisie. Ces efforts ont permis demettre en lumière les défis et les opportunités pour renforcer la qualité et l’efficacité de la recherche en Tunisie, offrant ainsi des pistes de réflexion et d’action pour les acteurs impliqués dans le domaine de la recherche. Les principaux thèmes abordés dans le rapport sont les suivants : Pilotage et organisation de la rechercheDémocratie de la rechercheCohérence de la rechercheEfficacité de la recherche Défis Identifiés dans le Système de Recherche Tunisien : La nécessité de professionnaliser la gestion des projets de recherche, de diversifier les sources de financement et d’améliorer l’efficacité de l’utilisation des ressources.L’importance de renforcer les collaborations entre chercheurs et entre les différentes entités de recherche, pour favoriser l’innovation et la qualité des travaux.La valorisation de la recherche et son impact sur l’innovation et le développement socio-économique du pays. Recommandations pour l’Amélioration de la Recherche en Tunisie : Mettre l’accent sur la gestion et la qualité des structures de recherche, ainsi que sur leur évaluation.Renforcer le cadre éthique et les normes des activités de recherche pour garantir la crédibilité et la reconnaissance.Encourager la recherche appliquée en lien avec les besoins régionaux et socio-économiques.Développer les collaborations entre chercheurs et les partenariats public-privé pour favoriser l’innovation et la création de réseaux de recherche communs. La lecture de ce rapport est essentielle pour comprendre les dynamiques actuelles de la recherche scientifique en Tunisie et les pistes à suivre pour renforcer la compétitivité internationale du pays.Il constitue une ressource précieuse pour les décideurs politiques tunisiens et tous les acteurs impliqués dans le domaine de la recherche. Visitez notre page de Ressources pour télécharger le rapport et approfondir nos découvertes.Si vous souhaitez recevoir le rapport par email, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter à l’adresse e-mail  info@dirasa.eu ..

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: Submitting to the 2025 global "Public Communication of Science & Technology Conference" (Aberdeen, UK) Détails
description: LAST CHANCE! Submitting to the 2025 global "Public Communication of Science & Technology Conference" (Aberdeen, UK) Abstract Submission Abstract submission is now open - and the Call for Proposals is below - so get your thinking caps on to come up with the best set of submissions for PCST yet! The PCST (Public Communication of Science and Technology) Network announces the call for proposals for its next conference, to be held in Aberdeen, Scotland, 27 – 29 May 2025. The global PCST Network is a professional networking and career development space for researchers, students, and practitioners who are involved in exploring or doing public communication of science. We invite science and technology communication researchers and practitioners to submit proposals for this conference, in line with the theme and guidelines below. Please submit your proposals via the online submission system no later than 7 September 2024 (17:00 BST). SUBMIT YOUR ABSTRACT HERE PCST 2025 Conference Theme The theme for the 2025 Conference is ‘Science communication for positive change: exploring transitions, traditions, and tensions.’ In our work as science communicators, we are influenced by transitions, traditions, and tensions. In 2025, the PCST Conference will bring us together to discuss how science communication can make a positive impact in our evolving world, particularly in the face of challenges like the climate crisis, global health concerns, and poverty. The conference will focus on three main themes: Transitions: We invite contributions that delve into the dynamics of change and stability in science communication. This includes transitions within organisations (e.g. universities) and groups (e.g. community organisations), power dynamics, advancements in science, technology, environmental sustainability, health and well-being, fairness, and aspects of cultures, citizenship, governance, and identity. Traditions: The theme of traditions encompasses the old, current, and new aspects of science and technology communication. We welcome submissions that explore how different forms of knowledge coexist, complement, or contradict each other. This can include perspectives on people, technologies, histories, and future developments in science and technology communication. Tensions: The tension theme examines how disputes and consensus influence science and technology communication. We encourage submissions that explore various tensions, such as theory versus practice, academics versus professionals, scientists versus citizens, expertise versus lived experience, different forms of knowledge production, communication versus engagement, and various forms of capital. By addressing these themes, we aim to better understand the role of science and technology communication in navigating a changing world and driving positive transformations. About PCST Conferences Biennial PCST conferences provide a meeting place for the global community of practitioners, educators, and researchers in the diverse and growing field of science and technology communication and engagement. These gatherings incorporate elements of academic and professional conferences, including presentations of research, reflections on practice, and practical workshops and demonstrations. The conferences are open to all who have a professional or personal interest in science communication, as practitioners, educators, researchers, or in any combination of these roles. During PCST conferences, science communication researchers and practitioners jointly explore the evolving relationship between science and society, and reflect on the evolving relationship between science communication research and practice. The 2025 conference will be the 18th event of its kind and is hosted by the University of Aberdeen in Scotland, UK. WEBSITE FOR THIS CALL FOR ABSTRACTS with further information: https://www.abdn.ac.uk/events/conferences/abstract-submission-3061.php

subtitle: Comment devenir un étudiant actif en Méditerranée? Détails
description: UNIMED – Union des universités méditerranéennes - et le réseau étudiant Erasmus – ESN, avec le soutien de l’Université de Palerme, organiseront à Palerme le troisième sommet des étudiants méditerranéens, une initiative qui cherche à rassembler des étudiants de l’enseignement supérieur de différents horizons et des deux rives de la Méditerranée pour favoriser le dialogue interculturel et travailler ensemble sur des défis communs.Après le succès des deux premières éditions, cette initiative est désormais établie comme un événement annuel axé sur l’engagement des étudiants et le dialogue interculturel avec les étudiants des universités UNIMED.

title: Coopération Internationale
subtitle: For Apac International Asia Know-How Summer School 2024   EXPLORE – INTERLINK – COMPREHEND Détails
description: Dear Ladies and Gentlemen, Dear Colleagues, Dear Students, Warm Greetings from the Forum Asia Pacific from the Paris Lodron University Salzburg! We hope this e-mail finds you well!We hereby would like to officially announce our FOR APAC INTERNATIONAL ASIA KNOW-HOW SUMMER SCHOOL 2024 EXPLORE – INTERLINK – COMPREHEND We are delighted to offer you two versions of this year’s Summer School with a rich program that includes three cities (long version) or one city (short version) and are very much looking forward to share the adventure with you. The Forum Asia Pacific (FOR APAC) continues the long Summer School tradition of the former Chinese Studies Center at the Paris Lodron University of Salzburg (PLUS), which has initiated its China Know-How Summer School in China for students from higher education institutions from Austria and other European countries in 1999. The Summer School was supported for many years by the Eurasia-Pacific Uninet (EPU). The FOR APAC Asia Know-How Summer School 2024 offers an exciting program, which will take place atPeking University(Beijing), Xi’an International Studies University (Xi’an), and Shanghaifrom August 17thto September 8th, 2024 (long version)respectively from17thto 31thAugust 2024 at Peking University (short version). The Summer School deals with various China or Asia-related topics in the globalized world of today with the aim to convey knowledge for a more profound understanding of China. Please find the announcement brochure, the tentative official program, and the poster in the attachment! We sincerely hope that this program will meet your interests. Please kindly forward this information to your colleagues who might be interested! The deadline for the online application and the nomination is the25thof June2024. We are very much looking forward to hearing from you and to cooperating with you in the frame of our FOR APAC International Asia Know-How Summer School 2024! (QR-Codes)

description: TheFondation Maison des sciences de l’homme (FMSH)and UNIMED have launched their call for application for short-term postdoctoral fellowships (2 or 3 months) in France. Young researchers native from Algeria, Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon, Morocco, Palestine, Syria and Tunisia and affiliated to one of the164 Universities member of UNIMEDare eligible for these fellowships. The applicants must be involved in research in social sciences and humanities (SSH) or at the frontier between SSH and other sciences. >Deadline for submission: March 18, 2024, 17:00 (Paris time). Here you can find the calland all useful information.
